meanings.definition: The ability to use military aircraft to achieve strategic or tactical objectives.
meanings.sent1: The country's airpower helped them win the war.
meanings.sent2: The airpower of the military was crucial in the battle.
meanings.sent3: The airpower of the planes made the enemy retreat quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like airpower, unstoppable and swift.
meanings.sent5: The airpower of the jets roaring overhead was deafening and awe-inspiring.

meanings.definition: The strength or force exerted by aircraft in combat or warfare.
meanings.sent1: The airpower of the bombers devastated the enemy's defenses.
meanings.sent2: The airpower of the fighter jets dominated the skies.
meanings.sent3: The airpower of the helicopters made the battlefield look like a beehive.
meanings.sent4: The airpower of the squadron was a storm of metal and thunder.
meanings.sent5: The airpower of the planes was like a hammer striking the anvil of war.
